entry.name: jQuery.cssNumber
entry.title: jQuery.cssNumber
entry.desc: An object containing all CSS properties that may be used without a unit. The .css() method uses this object to see if it may append px to unitless values.

longdesc.p: You can think about jQuery.cssNumber as a list of all CSS properties you might use without a unit. It's used by .css() to determine if it needs to add px to unitless values.

The keys of the jQuery.cssNumber object are camel-cased and the values are all set to true. If you want to prevent the .css() method from automatically adding the px unit for a specific CSS property, you can add an extra property to the jQuery.cssNumber object.
